hints.content:
Let's put our numbers into a place value table.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
- | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\maroonD{707}$ |  $\maroonD7$ | $\maroonD0$ | $\maroonD7$
$\blueE{253}$ | $\blueE2$ | $\blueE5$ | $\blueE3$

Now, we can break apart each number by place value.

$\maroonD{707}=\maroonD{7\text{ hundreds}} + \maroonD{7\text{ ones}}$.  

$\blueE{253}= \blueE{2\text{ hundreds}} + \blueE{5\text{ tens}} + \blueE{3\text { ones}}$.
$7\text{ hundreds} + 2\text{ hundreds} +5 \text{ tens}+7\text{ ones} +3 \text{ ones}$ is the same as $707 + 253$.

question.content:
**Which expression could be used to find the value of $707+253$?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: $7\text{ hundreds} + 0\text{ hundreds} +7 \text{ tens}+2\text{ tens} +5 \text{ ones}+3 \text{ ones}$
